meanings.definition: A person who makes a loud and confused noise, especially in protest or demand.
meanings.sent1: The clamorer outside City Hall was shouting for change.
meanings.sent2: The crowd of clamorers gathered outside the courthouse.
meanings.sent3: The clamorer at the town meeting was so loud, even the pigeons flew away.
meanings.sent4: Her voice rose above the clamorers like a lighthouse in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The image of the clamorer with a megaphone is etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: To make a loud and confused noise, especially in protest or demand.
meanings.sent1: Please do not clamorer during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The protesters began to clamorer for justice.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to clamorer for more recess time.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to clamorer all night long.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves clamorered against the rocks.
